revised_title: The Total Solar Eclipse of August 9, 1896: Expedition to Kio Island
tldr: The author describes an expedition to Kio Island to observe the total solar eclipse of August 9, 1896. They detail the organization, equipment, and observations made during the event, including the use of prismatic cameras, spectroscopes, and integrating spectroscopes. Although the expedition did not achieve its main objectives due to unfavorable weather, the author provides valuable insights into the methods and instruments used for studying solar eclipses.
